Issues.Title: add section to issue guide for known issues
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "add section to issue guide for known issues" (#919)

Issues.Title: manually set xlifftasks version
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "manually set xlifftasks version" (#918)

Issues.Title: Increase code coverage
Issues.Body:
I didn't see an issue for this already (feel free to close if there is one). Looks like coverage is less than 30%.
```
@@                 Coverage Diff                 @@
##              master        #914         +/-   ##
===================================================
- Coverage   28.94861%   28.94235%   -0.00626%     
===================================================
  Files           1083        1083                 
  Lines         294135      294133          -2     
  Branches       38407       38407                 
===================================================
- Hits           85148       85129         -19     
- Misses        204950      204965         +15     
- Partials        4037        4039          +2
```

@hughbe you've spent more time looking at the code/tests than many of us, how feasible do you think it is to get this number up? That would help increase confidence in the upcoming release, for sure - and make refactors less risky.

I wonder if the debt could be categorized somehow eg by namespace to make this easier to drive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Increase code coverage" (#917)

Issues.Body: …) where possible

Issues.Title: Cannot get .netcore 3.0 winforms project to work on macOS, no issue with console
Issues.Body:
I have installed both the runtime, and SDK 

If i use Visual Studio, it says ".net core 3.0(not installed)" in the created project

Also the following statement is in Visual Studio for mac

Error: The version of the .NET Core SDK currently installed (/usr/local/share/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview4-011223/Sdks) is not supported and continuing to use it may result in a broken tooling experience. https://aka.ms/vs/mac/install-netcore (NewWinFormsApp)

$bla dotnet new winforms -o NewWinFormsApp
The template "Windows Forms (WinForms) Application" was created successfully.

Processing post-creation actions...
Running 'dotnet restore' on NewWinFormsApp/NewWinFormsApp.csproj...
  Restore completed in 257.26 ms for /Users/bla/Downloads/dotnet-runtime-3.0.0-preview4-27615-11-win-x64/NewWinFormsApp/NewWinFormsApp.csproj.

Restore succeeded.

bla$ dotnet build
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.1.54-preview+gd004974104 for .NET Core
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

  Restore completed in 60.23 ms for /Users/bla/Downloads/dotnet-runtime-3.0.0-preview4-27615-11-win-x64/NewWinFormsApp/NewWinFormsApp.csproj.
/usr/local/share/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview4-011223/Sdks/Microsoft.NET.Sdk/targets/Microsoft.NET.RuntimeIdentifierInference.targets(151,5): message NETSDK1057: You are using a preview version of .NET Core. See: https://aka.ms/dotnet-core-preview [/Users/bla/Downloads/dotnet-runtime-3.0.0-preview4-27615-11-win-x64/NewWinFormsApp/NewWinFormsApp.csproj]
  NewWinFormsApp -> /Users/bla/Downloads/dotnet-runtime-3.0.0-preview4-27615-11-win-x64/NewWinFormsApp/bin/Debug/netcoreapp3.0/NewWinFormsApp.dll

Build succeeded.
    0 Warning(s)
    0 Error(s)

Time Elapsed 00:00:12.35

bla$ dotnet run
It was not possible to find any compatible framework version
The specified framework 'Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App', version '3.0.0-preview4-27613-28' was not found.
  - No frameworks were found.

You can resolve the problem by installing the specified framework and/or SDK.

The .NET Core frameworks can be found at:
  - https://aka.ms/dotnet-download



FYI - a build from a windows machine, has no issue

The specified framework 'Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App', version '3.0.0-preview4-27613-28' was not found.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot get .netcore 3.0 winforms project to work on macOS, no issue with console" (#908)

Issues.Title: Calling properties on new EventsTab(null) throws NRE
Issues.Body:
- Should we throw ANE in constructor?
- Or should we check for null in the props!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Calling properties on new EventsTab(null) throws NRE" (#899)

Issues.Title: Use Unsafe.AsRef to implement UnsafeNativeMethods.PtrToRef
Issues.Body: Follow-up to #818, per a request in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/835#discussion_r277804970.

Issues.Title: DataGridColumnStyle.FontHeight for column with table without grid throws NRE
Issues.Body: Should return the default font height
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridColumnStyle.FontHeight for column with table without grid throws NRE" (#895)

Issues.Title: Setting new DataGridColumnStyle().NullText to null unnecessarily invalidates
Issues.Body:
Also calls `OnNullTextChanged` even if nothing

E.g.
```cs
var style = new DataGridBoolColumn();
style.NullText = null;

style.NullText = null; // Invalidates again...
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting new DataGridColumnStyle().NullText to null unnecessarily invalidates" (#894)

Issues.Title: Some editors missing
Issues.Body: I can't see System.Drawing.Design.FontNameEditor and System.ComponentModel.Design.MultilineStringEditor.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Some editors missing" (#892)

Issues.Title: WinForms should test for binary serialization
Issues.Body:
Once you decide which types need to remain serializable #889 you need to test the remaining types for binary serialization.

These types should be tested to ensure they are serializable today, remain serializable in the future, and that they can round-trip to desktop.

Tests will likely involve consuming in binary payloads in test data and consuming this in tests.  You'll also likely want to annotate members that are forzen for serialization purposes.  @ViktorHofer did a lot of this work for CoreFx and may be able to provide some pointers.

This work should be semi-parallelizable with #889 since you know you have some types already that need to stay Serializable (EG: ImageList).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms should test for binary serialization" (#890)
